page.title: 03HOP GROWING IN PUTTENHAM
page.content: {Puttenham}is the only place in Surrey where hops are grown in 1985. They have been growing here for 140 years and there are still 4 hectares on the Hampton Estates. The chalk soil of the south facing slope of the Hog's Back is ideal though they grow too on the clay and greensand. They are expensive to grow because of the labour needed for stringing, training the vines, spraying and harvesting. The hops are cut in September, taken to the barn and put on hooks. A machine strips the vines and separates the leaves from the flowers which are then dried at a temperature of 60 degrees Celsius, cooled on a wooden floor and pressed into large bags. They are sent to Ledbury, where they are sold to breweries and used for flavouring beer.
